full_summary:
**Phase II Request for Proposal for Canada's Pavilion at the World Expo 2025, Osaka, Japan**

**Reference Number:** WS3694379354
**Amendment Number:** 12
**Solicitation Number:** WS3694379354
**Publication Date:** February 28, 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** April 18, 2023, 14:00:00
**Amendment Date:** April 14, 2023

**Objective:**

Canada intends to participate in the World Expo 2025, scheduled to take place in Osaka, Japan from April 13 to October 13, 2025. Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC), on behalf of Global Affairs Canada (GAC), invites qualified bidders to submit proposals for the design, construction, installation, operation, maintenance, and dismantling of Canada's pavilion.

**Key Features:**

The proposed pavilion will showcase Canada's creativity, diversity, vitality, and optimism for a sustainable future. The design will be specifically tailored to resonate with Japanese audiences and leave a lasting, positive impression of Canada. The pavilion will provide a memorable and distinctly Canadian visitor experience.

**Eligibility:**

Only bidders who have undergone the Phase 1 Invitation to Qualify (ITQ) process and have been prequalified by Canada will be eligible to submit a bid for this opportunity.

**Funding:**

The maximum funding available for the resulting contract is $25,000,000 CAD (exclusive of all applicable taxes).

**Procedure:**

Bidders who meet the eligibility requirements must submit a proposal in accordance with the instructions outlined in this request for proposal. An optional information session will be held online, and bidders are encouraged to participate.

**Contact Information:**

For further information, please contact Dale Rudderham, (SPAC/PSPC) at (dale.rudderham@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca).

**Note:**

This is a request for proposal, and a contract will be awarded based on the results of this process. Only qualified bidders will be considered for this opportunity. Thank you for your interest in this project.
